data.title: Sunday lunch
data.text: Ruth Ann's is a local restaurant that's open for breakfast and lunch Seven days a week.  They are known for their delicious breakfast as well as daily lunch specials.  One breakfast item I personally recommend is the Captain Crunch French Toast, you don't need syrup with this.

data.title: Best breakfast in town.
data.text: Love Ruth Ann's for breakfast. She has some of the best selection and good southern cooking. Love the sausage and the scrambled eggs. Cant go wrong with any of her breakfast selection. Great coffee and iced tea.  A local favorite.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Sunday morning for breakfast was very busy. Our meal was just okay.  I ordered the country ham.  The meat was paper-thin.  My over easy eggs were underdone.  The grits and toast were very good.  Husband's omelette was also underdone and hash browns were barely warm.  Disappointing after waiting 20 minutes for a table.

data.title: YUMMY!
data.text: Came in for a late breakfast after our soldier was released on family weekend.  Was so good came back again the next day.  Great food & excellent service.  Will visit again when we come back for Graduation.

data.title: 6 great friends
data.text:
Time for breakfast? 
Go to Ruth Ann's. Great service, super waitress and large menu. The most important meal of the day need to be good, go where the locals go. Enough said.

data.title: Great place for breakfast
data.text: Good service and an excellent breakfast menu. Nothing fancy as far as facilities but they are clean and well maintained. Close in parking.

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: Had breakfast on a Sunday morning with my wife and daughter.  Servings were large and prices fair for the amount of food (probably could have easily shared two plates between the three of us).  Selection, taste, and flavor were all good.  I would likely go there again if in the area.

data.title: Pleasant Waittresses, Good, Homestyle Breakfast!
data.text:
4 egg omelette, thick, hearty pancakes (tried the chocolate chip),
hash browns, and pretty much everything you need to get a great start to your day. Then walk it off in the historical district, or on the River Walk :)

data.title: rambling discovery
data.text: Happened upon the local spot, having evacuated from hurricane Matthew.  Delighted to find homestyle instead of chains.  Big serving sizes. Very tasty.  Both of us enjoyed our meals.  Service was a bit lax.  It was busy, we figured with so many seated, food was good.  I also got the whoopie cake to go since the waitress forgot to bring it to me first.  I was not happy with the filling, it seemed oily.  Otherwise, we would definitely stop in if in the area.

data.title: Dining
data.text: Third time dining at Ruth Ann's.  We come back out of state every time for the delicious captain  crunch french toast. My oh my tasty mouth watering and the whip cream on top delicious.  The service is excellent everyone is friendly.  We definitely will be back.

data.title: Great stop before the rapids!! Quick quality and quaint
data.text: The staff was super friendly and very accommodating.  The food was good.  My dad had fried green tomato Georgian Benedict.  I had a generic breakfast.  Good food for a budget.  Very convenient if your going white water rafting and looking for a quick bite before the rapids.  Limited menu but still good and quaint!

data.title: Down home breakfast
data.text: The place to go in columbus for downhome breakfasts. Also has some good lunch specials.check for meatlosf day.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: The food is great the atmosphere goes with what you would expect from a place like this I urge if you only go here once in your life get the country ham it will not disappoint along with the pancakes it's good and it's a reasonable price.

data.title: Fantastic Breakfast and Waitress
data.text: Staff is wonderful. Charming and make you feel right at home. The Biscuits and gravy was the best I have had! Eggs scrambled to perfection. Grits hit the spot. Thanks Ruth Ann's for a amazing breakfast.

data.title: Great Diner Style Breakfast
data.text: Ruth Ann's is a great place. The servers are friendly and the food is very good and filling to say the least. You must try an omelette or the Eggs Benedict. The omelette is a plate full and is served with hash browns. Give it a try I don't think you'll be disappointed.

data.title: Terrible service and food
data.text:
1) over 45 minute wait for a table (without seating)
2) over 30 minute wait to order food after drink order was placed. Drinks we not refilled during this time. 
3) the long awaited meal came and did not taste good. I got the red velvet pancakes.

data.title: Nothing Special
data.text: I had lunch and was prompted to do so based on good reviews from others.  The service was very good and I thought the place was very clean.  Perhaps the breakfast is good but the lunch was nothing special....in fact the potatoes were not good at all and the green beans once lived in a can.  I also thought it was expensive for what you get.  For me this was my first and last visit.  There are so many other "soul" food places in Columbus.  And I don't know why the sign on the place describes it as "soul" food.  I think this is becoming a Columbus fad.....and this place does not live up to it.

data.title: How I wish Ruth Ann's was within walking distance of my house!
data.text: What a great place! Everyone was very friendly, the room was very comfortable, cool and clean on a hot hot hot July day. The food was so good I couldn't believe it. FRESH vegetables, the best cole slaw I've had in a restaurant in years. Real turkey and cornbread dressing. MAC and CHEESE like it's supposed to be. So often in restaurants what passes for fresh is right off a vendor truck and was cooked and or prepared miles away. Ruth Ann's is the real deal. Great food, great service. I wish I could live nearby.

data.title: Pretty good breakfast. A bit pricey but fills you up!
data.text: Had a pancake breakfast. Was delicious and had a chance to fellowship with my brothers! Good times. Thanks!

data.title: Wonderful Local Diner
data.text: We enjoyed our breakfast at Ruth Ann's.  The food is good and the diner's atmosphere is comfortable and fun.  The service was friendly and efficient.  This is a good place for some delicious comfort food in a relaxing, laid-back atmosphere. It is close to the Riverwalk and Fort Benning.
